content.description: Easy climbing to the first bolt.  Get ready for some great exposure on the way to the second bolt.  Try to stay out of the dike on the right and learn to trust your scientific judgment of friction coefficients.  Come on, climbing isn't rocket science!
content.protection: 4 bolts lead to 2 chains.  Bring QDs and a helmet.
content.location: 100 feet to the left of Pocket Rocket.

content.description: Climb up dimpled limestone through vegetation and the occasional loose rock.  Hang on for dear life when you're exposed and the wind blows.  Friction is your friend!
content.protection: 10 bolts (last few bolts are shared) to Pocket Rocket's Chains.  Runout before jumping to the "second" pitch bolts.  Bring QDs and a helmet for loose rock.  Use bolt #5 (huge glue-in) on Pocket Rocket Right Variation for second rappel on descent or use a 70m rope.
content.location: On the main arete of the formation.

content.description: Sustained and exposed climbing for most of the climb.  The crux is just after the runout section towards the top. Try to find holds that won't flake off as you struggle to get over the bulge.
content.protection: 9 bolts to chains.  5.5 runout between bolts #5 and #6 with plenty of pockets and cracks for small to medium placements.  2 chains at the top.  Bring QDs and a helmet. 70 meter rope recommended, 60 meter rope required for rappel. You can use bolt #5 (huge glue-in) for second rappel.
content.location: This route is furthest to the west on the north face.
